intro: Hoffmannseggia stricta, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features narrow, blue-green leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It is well adapted to drought conditions, with deep roots that help it survive in sandy or rocky soils. Hoffmannseggia stricta plays an important role in stabilizing desert ecosystems and providing nectar for pollinators.
